column4: why this warning come when i use pppoe: Jul 27 02:16:51 kad pppd[7785]: Warning - secret file /etc/ppp/chap-secrets has world and/or group access
you should chown it to the dialout group and chmod it to 775
got u
thinking twice 775 might be not optimal... read the permissions factoid
same thing
should i use sticky ?
can u check default permissions with ur system?
no... just make it belong to :dialout and make yourself member of that group
actually i'm using root
and root is in the own files !
bad system admin... no bedtime story tonight :-)
chown it to root:dialout and make sure it's not worl readable
i did as u told me , there is no world user or group in my
'world' is a term for 'everyone' the last octet
aha these are permissions : drwxrwsr-x
a chmod 777 woul mak a file 'world writable' .
okie

should not... it'S a waring that everyone can read or modify your pppoe login, but it should still work
